examples: Each rung on this metaphorical ladder is a different way of measuring astronomical distances.
So at the dew point, our metaphorical sponge would be full and a cloud can be born.
So it might not just be a pain in the metaphorical physics butt.
Because by the time of the Space Race really took off in the mid 20th century, imperial powers had run out of corners of the world to plant metaphorical flags in.
It’s not that there are literal monsters and demons that stalk us day to day, it’s that King finds metaphorical ways to personify them.
words.defineEn: using a word, phrase, etc. not for its ordinary meaning, but for the idea or symbol that it represents or suggests
words.defineVi: sử dụng một từ, cụm từ, v.v. không phải vì ý nghĩa thông thường của nó, mà vì ý tưởng hoặc biểu tượng mà nó đại diện hoặc gợi ý

examples: Language is a window into the world.

words.defineEn: the system of communication by spoken or written words, that is used by people of a particular country or region

examples: Your arrogance only adds fuel to the fire Manfred.

words.defineEn: to provide the energy or motivation needed to drive or inspire a particular activity or process

examples: Hold your fire!

examples: - Do you all have the shining?

words.defineEn: radiating light or brightness, whether natural or artificial

examples: Even with a well-tailored suit, the politician's charisma couldn't overshadow the face that could stop a clock, with his sunken eyes, patchy beard, and receding hairline.

words.defineEn: to cause a person or thing to come across as less significant
words.defineVi: để gây ra một người hoặc điều đi qua như ít quan trọng

examples: Some bright spark left the tap running all night.
